understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() which returns a Serializer object. It checks if a custom journalSerializer has been set, and if not, it returns a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration of the Prevayler system. It is responsible for determining the Serializer to be used for journaling. If a custom Serializer is not set in the configuration, it defaults to using the JavaSerializer.

understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a private method named journalSerializer() that returns a Serializer object. It checks if a member variable _journalSerializer is not null, then returns that object, otherwise it creates and returns a new JavaSerializer object.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to configuration as it is responsible for determining which Serializer object to use. It checks if a custom Serializer object has been set using the _journalSerializer member variable, and if not, it falls back to using the default JavaSerializer. This method is crucial for configuring the serialization behavior of the Prevayler system.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is used when creating a Prevayler instance in the code. It is passed as a parameter to the PrevaylerImpl constructor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration is triggered whenever a new Prevayler instance is created in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _transactionDeepCopyMode configuration option on the system is related to how transaction deep copying is handled within the Prevayler implementation. Depending on the value of _transactionDeepCopyMode, the system may have different behaviors in terms of how transactions are copied and managed.
